job_description:

Cybersecurity Operations - Assist in monitoring security alerts and responding to basic security incidents - Perform routine vulnerability scans and help with basic security assessments - Support incident response activities under guidance - Help maintain security policies, procedures, and documentation

User & Identity Management - Manage user accounts and access through Google Admin and Azure Active Directory - Support Single Sign-On (SSO) configurations and user provisioning/de-provisioning - Manage group and role-based access controls in cloud environments

Compliance & Documentation - Assist in gathering data for security audits and compliance reports - Maintain accurate documentation of security configurations and processes - Support preparation of security awareness materials for users

job_title: Infosec L2 Security Analyst (Security Operations Center - Advanced)
job_description:
Infosec L2 Security Analyst (Security Operations Center - Advanced)

Location: Kochi Office (Onsite)

Job Summary: The L2 Security Analyst is responsible for performing advanced incident analysis, investigating security escalations from L1 analysts, conducting vulnerability assessments, and actively supporting threat hunting and malware analysis. This role acts as a critical link within the SOC by coordinating incident response efforts, ensuring compliance with security frameworks, and enhancing the organization's cybersecurity posture through diligent monitoring and remediation activities.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Monitor, analyze, and respond to alerts generated by firewalls, proxy servers, and intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS).
  • Perform rule tuning and assist in configuration adjustments of firewall, proxy, and IDS devices.
  • Handle escalations from L1 analysts and conduct in-depth investigations of security incidents and alerts.
  • Perform comprehensive log analysis, root cause analysis, threat hunting and forensic examinations.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders across IT, security, and business units to implement incident response and remediation.
  • Execute vulnerability assessments using tools like Nessus and Qualys; manage patching activities in coordination with relevant teams.
  • Participate in continuous threat hunting exercises and malware analysis to identify emerging threats.
  • Ensure adherence to security policies, standards, and regulatory frameworks such as ISO 27001, PCI DSS, and GDPR.
  • Maintain and update incident response playbooks; contribute to SOC process improvements.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentoring to L1 analysts.
  • Prepare detailed incident reports and documentation for stakeholders.

Required Experience and Qualifications:

  • 2 to 5 years of experience in cybersecurity operations, SOC, or IT infrastructure security.
  • Proven expertise with SIEM platforms (e.g., Splunk, QRadar), endpoint protection, and threat detection solutions.
  • Hands-on experience with vulnerability management tools such as Nessus, Qualys, or equivalent.
  • Familiarity with regulatory standards and compliance requirements (ISO 27001, PCI DSS, GDPR preferred).
  • Relevant security certifications such as CEH, CompTIA Security+, or equivalent are highly desirable.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
  • Effective communication skills with ability to liaise across technical and non-technical teams.

Preferred Skills:

  • Knowledge of malware analysis and computer forensic techniques.
  • Experience with scripting languages (Python, Bash) for automation and security tool enhancement.
  • Understanding of network security protocols and firewall management.
  • Ability to work collaboratively under pressure in a fast-paced, 24/7 operational environment.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at merin.cb@arttechgroup.com
summary: L2 Security Analyst investigates advanced security incidents, performs threat hunting, and manages vulnerability assessments. This role ensures robust cybersecurity posture and compliance.

About Us

Good Methods Global Inc is a global health-tech venture engineering CareStack™ - a powerful practice management cloud platform for dental practices in the US. CareStack™ empowers large dental groups as an all-in-one solution to increase productivity, minimize costs and improve patient dental care. Simply put, CareStack™ is rewriting the rules of what an intelligent solution should look like for dentistry.

CareStack™ is a venture funded by the same VC funds whose portfolio include Facebook, Flipkart, Freshdesk, Dropbox, BookMyShow, and many other leading technology enterprises. 4 years after the successful launch of CareStack, we wanted to partner with our customers to help them achieve higher revenue outcomes. Job Title: Content QA Specialist

Work Arrangement: On-site Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview

Way.com is looking for a detail-oriented Content QA Specialist to ensure the quality, accuracy, originality, and SEO performance of all published content. This role involves more than proofreading; you will be the final check for blogs, articles, and landing pages, ensuring they meet the highest standards of accuracy, originality, SEO performance, and brand consistency. Your expertise will be crucial in identifying low-quality or AI-generated content, ensuring compliance with Google’s EEAT principles (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness), and improving overall content effectiveness.

Key Responsibilities:

Content Review & Editorial Excellence - Review blogs, articles, and landing pages for grammar, clarity, tone, and brand voice alignment. - Correct factual errors, refine phrasing, and fix formatting issues to maintain high editorial quality.

SEO & Performance Optimization - Evaluate on-page SEO elements, including meta tags, headers, internal linking, and keyword usage. - Analyze content depth, relevance, and user value, flagging content lacking substance or actionable insights.

AI & Plagiarism Detection - Identify AI-generated or low-quality content using manual assessment and automated tools. - Conduct plagiarism checks to ensure content originality and protect brand credibility.

EEAT & Credibility Assurance - Validate author credentials and verify sources, especially for YMYL (Your Money or Your Life) topics. - Ensure all content adheres to EEAT standards to boost authority, expertise, and trustworthiness.

QA Process Enhancement - Maintain and improve QA checklists, processes, and best practices for consistent quality. - Provide clear, constructive feedback to writers and editors for continuous improvement.

Preferred Skills:

  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience in content quality assurance, editing, or SEO.
  • Exceptional manual editing skills with strong attention to detail.
  • Solid understanding of SEO fundamentals and Google’s content quality guidelines.
  • Ability to identify AI-generated content and assess its human readability.
  • Proficiency with tools such as Grammarly, Copyscape, Copyleaks, Originality.ai, or similar.
  • Skilled at identifying low-value or thin content and providing actionable improvement recommendations.
  • Comfortable working in a high-volume, fast-paced content production environment.
  • Educational or professional background in journalism, digital marketing, or technical writing.
  • Experience with content management systems like WordPress.
  • Familiarity with structured data, Yoast SEO plugin, and content scoring tools.
  • Understanding of content compliance processes and fact-checking workflows.

Why You Will Love Working With Us:

  • Opportunity to work for the #1 Auto Super app in the US.
  • Chance to make a significant impact on over 10 million users.
  • Dynamic, fast-paced, and innovation-driven work culture.
  • Clear career growth paths in a rapidly scaling technology company.
  • Competitive compensation.

Apply Now: https://waydot.greythr.com/hire/jobs/content-qa-specialist
